SEARCH
Package edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.models

Class GroceryBatch

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idi.idatt.models.GroceryBatch
public class GroceryBatch extends Object
A class representing a grocery batch.

Provides methods for getting the amount, price per unit, and expiration date of a grocery batch. Also provides a method for setting the amount of a grocery batch.

Since:
0.1
Author:
WilliamHoltsdalen

  • Constructor Details

    • GroceryBatch

      public GroceryBatch(double amount, double pricePerUnit, LocalDate expirationDate) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Constructs a new grocery batch with the provided amount, price per unit, and expiration date.

      The method validates the provided parameters and initializes the grocery batch with the provided values if they are all valid. If any of the provided parameters are negative or zero, or if the expiration date is null, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException.

      Parameters:
      amount - the amount of the grocery batch
      pricePerUnit - the price per unit of the grocery batch
      expirationDate - the expiration date of the grocery batch
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the provided parameters are negative or zero, or if the expiration date is null.

  • Method Details

      Returns the amount of the grocery batch.

    • setAmount

      private void setAmount(double amount) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Private method for setting the amount of the grocery batch.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount of the grocery batch
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the amount is less than or equal to zero.

    • updateAmount

      public void updateAmount(double newAmount) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Updates the amount of the grocery batch.

      If the new amount is less than or equal to zero, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException. If the new amount is greater than the current amount of the grocery batch, the method throws an IllegalArgumentException. Otherwise it updates the amount of the grocery batch to the provided value, by calling the private setAmount method.

      Parameters:
      newAmount - the new amount of the grocery batch
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the new amount is less than or equal to zero, or if the new amount is greater than the current amount of the grocery batch.

    • setPricePerUnit

      private void setPricePerUnit(double pricePerUnit) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Private method for setting the price per unit of the grocery batch.
      Parameters:
      pricePerUnit - the price per unit of the grocery batch
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the price per unit is less than zero.

    • setExpirationDate

      private void setExpirationDate(LocalDate expirationDate) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Private method for setting the expiration date of the grocery batch.
      Parameters:
      expirationDate - the expiration date of the grocery batch
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the expiration date is null.
